Online Web Performance kit today clkugoSrcAct A D V E R T I S E M E N T Catch of the Day Balance of power The California power grid is finally getting some official attention from the federal government When President Bush was in Los Angeles a week ago he met with Governor Gray Davis and also with business leaders to discuss the energy situation here As widely reported the Democrats response to the visit was not positive since Mr Bush declined to favor price controls to help ease Californias power bill However Mr Bushs reluctance means opportunity for entrepreneurs One of the attendees at the energy roundtable was John Woolard CEO of Silicon Energy He told me that Mr Bush who clearly trusts the supply side to modulate prices appeared extremely interested in the ability Silicon Energy has to send price signals into the system Johns company makes energy monitoring systems he has a technological solution for the free market John has something for the Dems too he said Governor Davis is keen to install Silicon Energys systems into state buildings Thats not surprising since without federal assistance Californias government is going to have a pretty big power bill itself Energy management makes sense even absent politics So I hope that after the crisis is over we continue to use power more intelligently Rafe Needleman Editor COMPANIES Silicon Energy Californias
